TRANSACTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AT A GLANCE

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR PROJECT PREPARATION 
 
A.  Justification 
 
1.  The transaction technical assistance (TA) will enhance readiness for the ensuing project. 
To satisfy Asian Development Bank’s (ADB) due diligence requirements, the depth and coverage 
of technical, financial, and economic analyses will be verified, reviewed, updated, strengthened, 
and presented in the prescribed format. Supplementary analyses on social and environmental 
safeguards also need to be prepared to comply with ADB requirements. The TA resources will be 
used to prepare these analyses and documentation to be considered by ADB Board of Directors. 
In addition, the TA will help to strengthen capacity for sound implementation and management of 
the ensuing project. 
 
B.  Outputs and Activities 
 
2.  Output 1: Technical feasibility study on ensuing project prepared. This output will 
support the review of project feasibility study reports and provide technical support to strengthen 
the project design. Key activities will include (i) comprehensively analyzing the local feasibility 
studies undertaken; (ii) determining the baseline situation in the project areas including land 
management,  social  and  economic  development  plan,  land  use  plan,  disaster  risk  hazard 
mapping,  and  relevant  environmental  regulations  and  policies;  (iii)  assessing  ongoing  and 
proposed pollution control and rehabilitation activities; (iv) studying the local situation to ensure 
the project is compliant with all the regulations and policies; (v) assessing the proposals for land 
remediation and restoration (including proposals for reuse of on-site material and imported 
material; and (vi) providing technical support to strengthen project design that includes an 
integrated  management  plan  for  economic  development,  pollution  control,  ecosystem 
rehabilitation, disaster resilience, and innovative approaches to mitigate the impact of climate 
change and improve natural resource management. 
 
3.  Output 2: Safeguard analysis and documentation completed. This output will support 
the review of and document preparation for project-related safeguards due diligence requirements. 
Key  activities  will  include  (i)  preparation  of  stakeholder  analysis,  participation  plan,  and 
stakeholder workshops across all levels; (ii) preparation of social and gender impact assessments; 
(iii) preparation of resettlement plans and ethnic minority development plans (as required); 
(iv) carrying out social, poverty, and gender assessments; (v) preparation of participation, gender, 
and capacity building plans; (vi) conducting a climate risk and vulnerability assessment; and 
(vii) preparation  of  subproject  environmental  impact  assessments  and  initial  environmental 
examination. 
 
4.  Output 3: Investment plan and procurement packages prepared. This output will 
support  the  review  and  preparation  of  economic,  financial,  and  governance  due  diligence 
requirements for project preparation. Key activities will include (i) financial and economic analyses; 
(ii) financial management assessment of executing and implementing agencies; (iii) preparation 
of procurement plan; and (iv) procurement capacity assessments of executing and implementing 
agencies. 
 
5.  Output  4:  Project  management  capacity  of  the  executing  and  implementing 
agencies improved. This output will strengthen the capacity of the executing and implementing 
agencies to improve project readiness and project implementation. Key activities will include           
(i) carrying out an institutional analysis of relevant institutions at project areas; (ii) reviewing and 
recommending the institutional capacity building requirements for the implementing agencies to

2 
enhance  cooperation  and  coordination  of  all  agencies;  (iii)  providing  training  in  project 
management, safeguards, and procurement; and (iv) finalizing project documents. 
 
C.  Cost and Financing 
 
6.  The TA is estimated to cost $440,000, of which $400,000 will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources).

finance any ensuing project. 
 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
8.  ADB will administer the TA. The Urban and Social Sectors Division of the East Asia 
Department (EARD) will work closely with the People’s Republic of China counterparts and will 
coordinate the TA with the support from other divisions of EARD including Environment, Natural 
Resources and Agriculture Division.

10.  Consulting services. ADB will engage a consulting firm following the ADB’s Procurement 
Policy (2017, as amended from time to time) and its associated project administration instructions 
and/or staff instructions. The consulting firm will be selected using quality- and cost-based 
selection method, with 90:10 quality–cost ratio and full technical proposal procedure. A total of 
30 person-months of consulting inputs from 7 international experts (10 person-months) and 
8 national experts (20 person-months) will be required (Table 3).
